column4: hi, my sound has stopped working after a computer restart. How do I fix it?
I don't think so
on the icon the "mute all" is light
the red bar is medium
did you install any new softwares before you rebooted?
speaker-test -c 2 -t wav
yes, this is a direct alsa test, bypassing pulse
http://pastebin.com/DsWnNa33
you heard nothing?
it may be related, I can no longer use my usb drive
i'm guessing you need to set SPDIF or IEC9?? to mute, also check if something is hogging the sound devices, only pulse should be listed: sudo fuser -v /dev/dsp* /dev/snd/* /dev/seq*
nothing is listed after that command list
oh. does the following list something : aplay -l
aplay: device_list:223: no soundcards found...
oh, sounds like kernel modules aren't loaded: lsmod | grep snd
http://pastebin.com/CKfmrj5c
that looks fine. i'm getting more confues. Did you try rebooting, i would prefer to debug on another boot, since something seems inconsistent.
I logged out and back in, does rebooting affect the hardware differently? I hadn't rebooted in a long while, I just do log out/log in when I install new programs and updates
sound setup is done through boot scripts, you would need a complete reboot (there are other ways though) to get sound reset.
it works now :P   I also had trouble rebooting had to do "sudo reboot"
cool
thanks for the help
